text: If we don't know life, how can we know death?

author: Socrates
text: Ordinary people seem not to realize that those who really apply themselves in the right way to philosophy are directly and of their own accord preparing themselves for dying and death.

author: Giacomo Casanova
text: Should I perchance still feel after my death, I would no longer have any doubt, but I would most certainly give the lie to anyone asserting before me that I was dead.

author: Harriet Tubman
text: I had reasoned this out in my mind, there was one of two things I had a right to, liberty or death; if I could not have one, I would have the other.

author: Jay Parini
text: I came to know Gore Vidal in the mid-1980s, when I was living in southern Italy, virtually a neighbour, and our friendship lasted until his death in 2012. Needless to say, he was a complicated and often combative man.

author: Mads Mikkelsen
text: I will never be a fan of any kind of political correctness: I think it's instant death to creativity.

author: Ward Churchill
text: I am not a 'defender' of the September 11 attacks, but simply pointing out that if U.S. foreign policy results in massive death and destruction abroad, we cannot feign innocence when some of that destruction is returned.

author: Aberjhani
text: The political, social, and spiritual impact of the life example set by Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela might be measured in part by the profound and unique gestures made by people in different countries to honor his life upon learning of his death.

author: Darren Star
text: Cable's on fire. Traditional broadcast TV's hearing a death knell. I sample as much television as possible. I like 'Homeland,' 'Game of Thrones,' 'Veep.' Now reinvention's important.

author: Raymond Carver
text: Life and death matters, yes. And the question of how to behave in this world, how to go in the face of everything. Time is short and the water is rising.

author: Soren Kierkegaard
text: There are, as is known, insects that die in the moment of fertilization. So it is with all joy: life's highest, most splendid moment of enjoyment is accompanied by death.

author: Scott Ritter
text: It is hard as an American to support the failure of American military operations in Iraq. Such failure will bring with it the death and wounding of many American service members, and many more Iraqis.

author: Aimee Carter
text: 'Harry Potter' changed my life in more ways than one, and it helped me get through my mother's death.

author: Mel Brooks
text: If Shaw and Einstein couldn't beat death, what chance have I got? Practically none.

author: Golshifteh Farahani
text: Exile is like death. You cannot understand it until it happens to you.

author: Florentijn Hofman
text: The slugs are ascending this steep city staircase that leads up to a huge Catholic church, essentially signifying their slow crawl towards death. The work reminds us of religion, mortality, natural decay, and the slow suffocation of commercialized societies.

author: Wallace Stevens
text: Death is the mother of Beauty; hence from her, alone, shall come fulfillment to our dreams and our desires.

author: Viggo Mortensen
text: I'm not afraid of death, but I resent it. I think it's unfair and irritating.

author: Russell M. Nelson
text: Contemplation of life after retirement and life after death can help you deal with contemporary challenges.

author: Steven Seagal
text: I have no fear of death. More important, I don't fear life.

author: John Wayne
text: Courage is being scared to death... and saddling up anyway.

author: James Dean
text: Death can't be considered because, if you're afraid to die, there's no room in your life to make discoveries.

author: Henry Rollins
text: If the death of Osama Bin Laden brings any peace to those who lost loved ones on that awful day in September 2001, that is a great thing. It is more likely, however, just a painful reminder of what was lost.

author: Nancy Gibbs
text: Death will never be pretty - its sights and smells too close and crude. And it will never come under our control: it gallops where we tiptoe, rips up our routines, burns our very breath with its heat and sting.

author: Josh Homme
text: I look at my career as a body of work, not just Queens of the Stone Age records. I'm in Eagles of Death Metal, I'm in Them Crooked Vultures; I make records with other people.

author: Plato
text: Know one knows whether death, which people fear to be the greatest evil, may not be the greatest good.

author: Arthur Koestler
text: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.

author: Asa Hutchinson
text: I believe Timothy McVeigh getting the death penalty for his heinous act of killing over a hundred in Oklahoma City, that could very well deter others that might want to enter into that similar conduct.

author: Floyd Patterson
text: Fear was absolutely necessary. Without it, I would have been scared to death.

author: John Strachan
text: Rather than allow themselves to be separated from the love of Christ, they submitted cheerfully to every privation, to contumely and disgrace, and to death itself.

author: Harold Brodkey
text: So an autobiography about death should include, in my case, an account of European Jewry and of Russian and Jewish events - pogroms and flights and murders and the revolution that drove my mother to come here.

author: Hugh Laurie
text: Humility was considered a great virtue in my family household. No show of complacency or self-satisfaction was ever tolerated. Patting yourself on the back was definitely not encouraged, and pleasure or pride would be punishable by death.

author: Jesse Ventura
text: I don't think I would want the responsibility for enforcing the death penalties. There's always the inevitable question of whether someone you gave the order to execute might truly have been innocent.

author: J. R. R. Tolkien
text: Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends.

author: Theodor Adorno
text: Normality is death.

author: Robert Hunter
text: When I got out of the hospital, it was one of those classic things - you're looking death in the eye, and it changes you. I thought, I ought to go back on the road.

author: Viktor Orban
text: The death penalty question should be put on the agenda in Hungary.

author: Jacqueline Cochran
text: It comes with faith, for with complete faith there is no fear of what faces you in life or death.

text: Bruce Willis is Bruce Willis in every single movie I've seen him in, except 'Death Becomes Her' and 'Mortal Thoughts,' which is another movie he was in that was very different from what he normally does.

author: Brad Thor
text: Even one death is horrible.

author: Tom Drury
text: Rather than writing about international events, I write about individual lives. There is elation and sadness, death and birth, love and jealousy, co-operation and betrayal. All the great emotional transactions that happen wherever people come together.

author: Patty Duke
text: The panic attacks - I still have them. They started when I was around 8. They always have to do with my death.

author: Michelangelo
text: If we have been pleased with life, we should not be displeased with death, since it comes from the hand of the same master.

author: Kate Klise
text: I want to give kids that fall-off-the-bed-laughing feeling. Either that, or the sixth-grade feeling that life is hard - sometimes unbearably hard - and it is ultimately about death. But in the meantime, life can be really funny, too.

author: Karen Salmansohn
text: In Hinduism, Shiva is a deity who represents transformation. Through destruction and restoration, Shiva reminds us that endings are beginnings, and that our world is constantly undergoing a cycle of birth, death and rebirth.

author: Donald Johanson
text: I think that many of my ideas are correct, but I'll bet you, before my death other discoveries will be made that will prompt me to alter various ideas I have about human evolution.

text: The death of JFK to the resignation of Richard Nixon marked a great turning point in American life.

author: Enid Bagnold
text: As for death one gets used to it, even if it's only other people's death you get used to.

author: Tryon Edwards
text: Every parting is a form of death, as every reunion is a type of heaven.

author: Ovid
text: A new idea is delicate. It can be killed by a sneer or a yawn; it can be stabbed to death by a quip and worried to death by a frown on the right man's brow.

author: Samantha Fox
text: I can't beleive I'm here to tell the tale, this was my first brush with death, and God must have been looking after us and obviously, it wasn't our time.

author: Christopher Hitchens
text: Well, to the people who pray for me to not only have an agonising death, but then be reborn to have an agonising and horrible eternal life of torture, I say, 'Well, good on you. See you there.'

author: Jai Rodriguez
text: My mother thought me being gay was a death sentence.

author: J. M. Coetzee
text: Lebanon, Israel, Ireland, South Africa - wherever there is a bleeding sore on the body of the world, the same hard-eyed narrow-minded fanatics are busy, indifferent to life, in love with death.

author: Robert De Niro
text: You'll have time to rest when you're dead.

author: Anne Fortier
text: I'm from Europe, and I was very aware that there are a lot of literature snobs - especially in Europe. As soon as something becomes a success, it has to be bad, and then they'll do everything they can to stab it to death.

author: Jessica Raine
text: I have a gorgeous coat that I found at a vintage fair - it's just so elegant. Unfortunately, it has a massive hole underneath the arm, as I think I may have worn it to death!

author: Hedy Lamarr
text: I don't believe in life after death. But I do believe in some grinding destiny that watches over us on earth. If I didn't, the safety valve would give and the boiler would explode.

author: Socrates
text: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.

author: John Perez
text: Organ donation is very personal to me. My mother, before her death, was on kidney dialysis for several years.

author: Kirk Cameron
text: What can separate us from the love of God? Not life, not death, nothing in the present, nothing in the future. Not angels, not demons nothing is able to stand between us and his loving plans because you can't stop them.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
text: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.

author: Hans Urs von Balthasar
text: But the issue is not only life and death but our existence before God and our being judged by him. All of us were sinners before him and worthy of condemnation.

author: Rey Mysterio

author: Russell M. Nelson
text: From an eternal perspective, the only death that is truly premature is the death of one who is not prepared to meet God.

author: Ric Keller
text: The death tax causes one-third of all family-owned small businesses to liquidate after the death of the owner. It is also an unfair tax because the assets have already been taxed once at their income level.

author: Alan Dale
text: I did a production of Macbeth in the 1960s in which I had a swordfight in the final scene. But the blade fell off my sword just as I was stabbing the guy. I ended up having to hammer him to death.

author: Samuel Butler
text: The history of the world is the record of the weakness, frailty and death of public opinion.

author: Christopher Hitchens
text: I have more than once in my time woken up feeling like death.

author: Dennis Miller
text: The death penalty is becoming a way of life in this country.

author: Jeanne Moreau
text: Death is an absolute mystery. We are all vulnerable to it, it's what makes life interesting and suspenseful.

author: Abu Bakr
text: There is no harm in patience, and no profit in lamentation. Death is easier to bear (than) that which precedes it, and more severe than that which comes after it. Remember the death of the Apostle of God, and your sorrow will be lessened.

author: Chiang Kai-shek
text: The rise or fall of Shanghai means the birth or death of the whole nation.

author: Henry Van Dyke
text: What you possess in the world will be found at the day of your death to belong to someone else. But what you are will be yours forever.

author: Rachel Hunter
text: God and death kind of resemble each other, because the only time a lot of people will try and talk to God is when someone's died.

author: Kit Bond
text: The death tax is one of the leading causes of the dissolution of small businesses.

author: Cat Stevens
text: Salman Rushdie, indeed any writer who abuses the prophet or indeed any prophet under Islamic law, the sentence for that is actually death.

author: Alfred North Whitehead
text: Not ignorance, but ignorance of ignorance, is the death of knowledge.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
text: It is the cause, not the death, that makes the martyr.

text: I have a store full of thousands and thousands of images in my brain. I've got this terrible feeling I'm like some abattoir boss: I know death; I know the cut pieces of the human body.

author: Paul Lynde
text: If I ever completely lost my nervousness I would be frightened half to death.

author: Ehud Barak
text: If Israel does not find the way to disengage from the Palestinians, its future might resemble the experience of Belfast or Bosnia - two communities bleeding each other to death for generations.

text: Before I pitch any game, from spring training to Game 7 of the World Series, I'm scared to death.

text: Families survive, one way or another. You have a tie, a connection that exists long after death, through many lifetimes.

text: Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome.

text: There should be weeping at a man's birth, not at his death.

author: George Ryan
text: I support the death penalty. But I also think there has to be no margin for error.

author: RJ Mitte

author: John Tavener

text: Life isn't fair. It's just fairer than death, that's all.

text: When I'm lying in my bed I think about life and I think about death and neither one particularly appeals to me.

text: I'm not sure yet what my higher mission is, but I have a feeling it might be great. Before, I thought my mission was death, but now my mission is life.

text: Around the district, I've talked to more local bankers who are scared to death.

author: Sarah Vowell
text: Most people don't like to talk about violent historical death.

author: Chuck Palahniuk
text: Any real belief in death is just wishful thinking.

text: I get involved if a problem comes up after the death has been investigated by the local authority.

text: Death always seems to be around me.

author: Gerald Brenan
text: Middle age snuffs out more talent than even wars or sudden death does.

text: For me it was a lot harder to come to terms with the death of my grandfather than it was to come to terms with what's happened to the former Yugoslavia.

text: There are people who never experience that, who remain closed until death, from fear of change.

text: One death is a tragedy; one million is a statistic.

author: Georges Bernanos

text: All my life as an artist I have asked myself: What pushes me continually to make sculpture? I have found the answer. art is an action against death. It is a denial of death.

author: Horace
text: He has not lived badly whose birth and death has been unnoticed by the world.

author: James Stephens
text: Finality is death. Perfection is finality. Nothing is perfect. There are lumps in it.

text: First need in the reform of hospital management? That's easy! The death of all dietitians, and the resurrection of a French chef.

text: I don't know what my Death Row meal would be. I'm surprised that people can even eat when they're on Death Row.

author: John Clare

text: The valiant never taste of death but once.

text: The fear of death often proves mortal, and sets people on methods to save their Lives, which infallibly destroy them.

text: I think about death a lot, like I think we all do. I don't think of suicide as an option, but as fun. It's an interesting idea that you can control how you go. It's this thing that's looming, and you can control it.

text: Time turns the old days to derision, Our loves into corpses or wives; And marriage and death and division Make barren our lives.

author: Marlene Dietrich
text: Grumbling is the death of love.

author: Katherine Paterson
text: Death is very mysterious to us. One moment someone is there with us, and the next moment they're not.

author: Nostradamus

author: Owain Yeoman
text: I think from an actor's point of view, you always want something to play that's dramatic or something that feels like it could be very bold in choice. And of course, the boldest possible choice you could play at the end of a character's life is death.

author: Steve Tisch
text: I don't think an NC-17 rating is the kiss of death. Nor do I think that, in the hands of the right filmmakers, studios have a preconceived notion to pass on NC-17 material.

author: Meghan O'Rourke
text: My mother died of metastatic colorectal cancer shortly before three P.M. on Christmas Day of 2008. I don't know the exact time of her death, because none of us thought to look at a clock for a while after she stopped breathing.

author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
text: Smiles, tears, of all my life! - and, if God choose, I shall but love thee better after death.

author: Stella Young
text: I am not a snowflake. I am not a sweet, infantilising symbol of fragility and life. I am a strong, fierce, flawed adult woman. I plan to remain that way, in life and in death.

text: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.

text: Even when you're making a movie about life, death is a presence, and I guess it's part of my dramatic viewpoint. I'm not sure why exactly. Maybe I'm drawn to it as a story element.

text: Homeland or death! Socialism or death! We shall overcome!

text: I'm certainly not squeamish at all. The countryside makes you very aware of birth and death.

text: I never kissed my father until he was on his death bed.

author: Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu
text: Life and death are illusions. We are in a constant state of transformation.

author: Tim Kaine
text: My faith teaches that life is sacred. That's why I personally oppose the death penalty. But I take my oath of office seriously, and I'll enforce the death penalty... because it's the law.

author: Alan Ball
text: It's hard for me to get interested in stories that ignore death, which is what American marketing culture would like to do: pretend that death doesn't exist, that you can buy immortality; just buy these products, and you'll be forever young and happy.

author: Timothy Noah
text: In shuttering Yucca Mountain, Obama makes it extremely likely that nuclear power in the United States will continue its long, slow, and extremely welcome death.

author: Adam Mansbach
text: The publishing industry stopped having new ideas out of respect for the untimely death of Ernest Hemingway in 1961 and has been doing everything the same way ever since.

author: Philip Larkin
text: Death is no different whined at than withstood.

author: Steve Gleason
text: I think about death all the time. I think that's a good thing because we're all going to die, and the only thing we can control is how we are and what we're doing in the meantime.

text: I was very sad to hear of the death of Ronnie Barker, who was such a warm, friendly and encouraging presence to have when I started in television. He was also a great comic actor to learn from.

author: William Hull
text: Captain Hale, alone, without sympathy or support, save that from above, on the near approach of death asked for a clergyman to attend him. It was refused. He then requested a Bible; that too was refused by his inhuman jailer.

author: Belle Boyd
text: I thank God that I can say on my death bed that I am a virtuous woman.

author: A. S. Byatt
text: In our world of sleek flesh and collagen, Botox and liposuction, what we most fear is the dissolution of the body-mind, the death of the brain.

author: Daniel Radcliffe
text: I'm possibly a very morbid person but I think about death a lot.

author: Grace Poe
text: If, through death penalty, we can create fears, though it's against my will, we have to do it.

author: Samantha Bond
text: I've been married to the same man - even after the separation - longer than most people in this business. I'm sick to death of people mentioning it.

author: Katha Pollitt
text: It's a rare pro-lifer who is against the death penalty, who's against all war, who favors, you know, all the things people need to flourish and stay healthy in life. They've tied themselves to the Republican Party, which doesn't support any of that.

author: Beth Gibbons
text: I thought I had a clear picture of death, but now I know it's a mystery and it will always be a mystery, although it is something we all have in common: everybody knows that life ends with death.

author: Mark Shields
text: Since the election, since the formation of a government, the death in Iraq has increased. The United States stands by, helpless to do anything about it. That's the reality, not George Bush's revisionist history!

author: Paul Di Filippo
text: The three touchstones that woke Buddha up - sickness, old age, and death - are a pretty good place to start when crafting a tragic tale. And if we need to get more specific: heartbreak, destruction, miscomprehension, natural disasters, betrayal, and the waste of human potential.

author: Berenice Abbott
text: Does not the very word 'creative' mean to build, to initiate, to give out, to act - rather than to be acted upon, to be subjective? Living photography is positive in its approach, it sings a song of life - not death.

author: Dean Koontz
text: Like all of us in this storm between birth and death, I can wreak no great changes on the world, only small changes for the better, I hope, in the lives of those I love.

author: Stephen Baldwin
text: I've been to MTV and all of that worldly stuff. It's death. It's meaningless.

author: Francis Bacon
text: I do not believe that any man fears to be dead, but only the stroke of death.

author: Dawn Powell
text: The basis of tragedy is man's helplessness against disease, war and death; the basis of comedy is man's helplessness against vanity (the vanity of love, greed, lust, power).

author: Ken Stott
text: 'Death Of A Salesman' is a great acting job.

author: John Bacon
text: We will grieve not, rather find strength in what remains behind. In the faith that looks through death, in years that bring the philosophic mind.

author: Keith Henson
text: People can undergo a sudden change of thinking and loyalties under threat of death or intense social pressure and isolation from friends and family.

author: John Cusack

author: Natalie Cole
text: The medication I had to take was a form of chemotherapy. You feel like death every day. No appetite. No energy. But the treatment worked. It cured my liver 80 per cent but compromised my kidneys.

author: Seung Sahn

author: Ezra Taft Benson
text: Retirement from work has depressed many a man and hastened his death.

author: Mahatma Gandhi

author: John Greenleaf Whittier

author: Elizabeth Warren
text: Bankruptcy is about financial death and financial rebirth. Bankruptcy is the great American story rewritten. We're a nation of debtors.

text: Humans are insane. We kill our own people, starve our own people, sell them, work them to death, beat them, don't give them affordable/free/good healthcare, and let them live in misery, while a few of us have - we have all we want. We are evil.

author: Guru Nanak

author: Ben Vereen

text: Any man who has $10,000 left when he dies is a failure.

text: Believe me, if a man doesn't know death, he doesn't know life.

text: No evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.

author: Laura Linney
text: The thing about death is that it's honest.

author: Plautus
text: Property is unstable, and youth perishes in a moment. Life itself is held in the grinning fangs of Death, Yet men delay to obtain release from the world. Alas, the conduct of mankind is surprising.

author: Sherrilyn Kenyon
text: Death is the one predator we can't escape. But vampires have found the loophole so many of us crave. I think that's the allure of vampirism.

author: Benjamin Franklin
text: I look upon death to be as necessary to our constitution as sleep. We shall rise refreshed in the morning.

author: David Mitchell
text: If the human condition were the periodic table, maybe love would be hydrogen at No. 1. Death would be helium at No. 2. Power, I reckon, would be where oxygen is.

author: Peter Singer
text: Almost everybody accepts that some people can be killed. 'The concept of 'brain death' - the belief that people on respirators can legitimately be killed - shows that.

author: Lobsang Tenzin
text: No one can avoid death; it is inevitable. Therefore, I should create in my mind a kind of willingness and accepting for that event without any fear.

author: Erik Erikson
text: Healthy children will not fear life if their elders have integrity enough not to fear death.

author: Georges Rouault
text: The richness of the world, all artificial pleasures, have the taste of sickness and give off a smell of death in the face of certain spiritual possessions.

author: Woody Allen
text: There are worse things in life than death. Have you ever spent an evening with an insurance salesman?

author: Laura Fraser
text: When I was 18, I couldn't wait to move away. I was like: 'If I ever have to come back here, I'll kill myself.' Glasgow seemed like failure and death to me back then, but not any more.

author: Shirley Booth
text: Why is it that men who can go through severe accidents, air raids, and any other major crisis always seems to think that they are at death's door when they have a simple head cold?

author: Jaime Lerner
text: I always run into these Ph.D.s. They write and write and write about sustainable development. Then these guys ask me, 'But, how do you do it?' They are scared to death to do anything.

author: Christian Slater
text: Tony Scott was one of the best directors I've ever worked with, and I was devastated when I heard about his death. He was a great guy with great energy. But this is a difficult business, and people's lives are sometimes difficult.

author: Billy Graham
text: Racism and injustice and violence sweep our world, bringing a tragic harvest of heartache and death.

author: Alain de Botton
text: The death of marriage has been announced so often and would seem so normal, in a sense. So what's surprising is the sheer longevity and tenacity of this institution.

author: Duane Chapman
text: The closest thing to hell on earth is prison. It's the worst experience I've ever had in my life. Besides death.

author: N. T. Wright
text: You can't reconcile being pro-life on abortion and pro-death on the death penalty.

author: Oliver Joseph Lodge
text: Death is not a word to fear, any more than birth is.

author: Emily Dickinson
text: Love is anterior to life, posterior to death, initial of creation, and the exponent of breath.

author: Norman Cousins
text: The tragedy of life is in what dies inside a man while he lives - the death of genuine feeling, the death of inspired response, the awareness that makes it possible to feel the pain or the glory of other men in yourself.

author: Len Cariou
text: I grew up in Winnipeg, in the Canadian midwest, the fifth child. It was a great household to grow up in - I was loved to sweet death.

author: Stewart Udall
text: I like the story about Henry David Thoreau, who, when he was on his death bed, his family sent for a minister. The minister said, 'Henry, have you made your peace with God?' Thoreau said, 'I didn't know we'd quarreled.'

author: Helen Fisher
text: Throughout evolution, ostracism was death indeed.

author: Sulaiman Abdul Aziz Al Rajhi
text: Usually, people in the Islamic world set aside one-third or one-fourth of their wealth for endowment, and that will be effective only after their death. But in my case, I decided to implement this decision in my lifetime itself.

author: Joshua Oppenheimer
text: I still receive very regular death threats that make it impossible for me to return to Indonesia. I think I could get in, but I don't think I could get out again.

author: George Fox
text: I saw also that there was an ocean of darkness and death, but an infinite ocean of light and love, which flowed over the ocean of darkness.

author: Kara Swisher
text: I don't think you can look at my history and say they love me to death in Silicon Valley.

author: Russell M. Nelson
text: The only way to take sorrow out of death is to take love out of life.

author: Edwin M. Stanton
text: All persons harboring or secreting the conspirators or aiding their concealment or escape, will be treated as accomplices in the murder of the President and shall be subject to trial before a military commission, and the punishment of death.

author: Frank Sinatra
text: I'm gonna live till I die.

author: Mary Catherine Bateson
text: The timing of death, like the ending of a story, gives a changed meaning to what preceded it.

author: Albert Camus
text: I am not made for politics because I am incapable of wanting or accepting the death of the adversary.

author: Christopher Koch
text: Even a cup of coffee tastes so much sweeter because you've come once again out of the, literally, out of the edge of death, and that's the condition I suppose that a lot of artists and writers would like to be in.

author: Norman Davies
text: Serenity is the balance between good and bad, life and death, horrors and pleasures. Life is, as it were, defined by death. If there wasn't death of things, then there wouldn't be any life to celebrate.

author: Tom Berenger
text: I was so exhausted after fighting for the project for five years, shooting it was like the Bataan Death March.

author: Glenn Danzig
text: David Bowie's death came out of the blue, as did Prince's.

author: Johnny Cash
text: Of emotions, of love, of breakup, of love and hate and death and dying, mama, apple pie, and the whole thing. It covers a lot of territory, country music does.

author: Dave Barry
text: The leading cause of death among fashion models is falling through street grates.

author: Hilaire Belloc
text: Loss and possession, death and life are one, There falls no shadow where there shines no sun.

author: Michel de Montaigne
text: Death, they say, acquits us of all obligations.

author: Winston Churchill
text: I am prepared to meet my Maker. Whether my Maker is prepared for the great ordeal of meeting me is another matter.

author: Albert Einstein
text: The fear of death is the most unjustified of all fears, for there's no risk of accident for someone who's dead.

author: Philippe Petit
text: You see, it's actually very good that a human activity is performed very close to death, because that's where life is. Life is, at its most valuable and most full, very close to the boundary of life.

author: Susan Griffin
text: Philosophy means nothing unless it is connected to birth, death, and the continuance of life. Anytime you are going to build a society that works, you have to begin from nature and the body.

author: Joseph Hall
text: Death borders upon our birth, and our cradle stands in the grave.

author: Robert Browning
text: A face to lose youth for, to occupy age With the dream of, meet death with.

author: E. M. Forster
text: Death destroys a man, but the idea of death saves him.

author: Tammy Bruce
text: When the courts decide that murderers, rapists, and others who maliciously break our social contract deserve health care that most working Americans can't afford, they are condemning good people to death.

author: Charles Frohman
text: Why fear death? It is the most beautiful adventure in life.

author: George Lois
text: A graphic designer, you know, who understands ideas and understands that ideas are what makes the world go round, could change the world with a magazine. If one talent could do it right now, and everybody would stop saying it's the death of magazines.

author: Daron Malakian
text: I like structuring verses, choruses, but sometimes the verses might be a tango and the choruses might be death metal.

author: Alexander Chase
text: Lovers of air travel find it exhilarating to hang poised between the illusion of immortality and the fact of death.

author: Caitlin Doughty
text: I've worked very hard to become comfortable with how death works and why it happens. I now know that death isn't out to get me.

author: Travis Bradberry
text: Teaching emotional intelligence skills to people with life-threatening illnesses has been shown to reduce the rate of recurrence, shrink recovery times, and lower death rates.

author: George Edward Woodberry
text: Seasonal changes, as it were, take place in history, when there is practically an almost universal death, a falling of the foliage of the tree of life. Such were the intervals between the ancient and mediaeval time, the mediaeval and the modern.

author: Robert Drew
text: I made four films on John F. Kennedy, filmed when he was running for office, in office, and after his death.

author: Alice McDermott
text: I'm interested in characters who should know better, who know they should give up, move on, accept life as it is, with all its constraints - life, death, time - but don't.

author: Chuck Norris
text: Between income taxes and employment taxes, capital gains taxes, estate taxes, corporate taxes, property taxes, Social Security taxes, we're being taxed to death.

author: Emma Thompson
text: I was brought up by very witty people who were dealing with quite difficult things: disease and death... I was brought up by people who tended to giggle at funerals.

author: Taya Kyle
text: I think that God prepared me for Chris's death in some ways, because I've seen other people lose their spouses. I've known for a long time that life isn't fair.

author: Ronda Rousey
text: At home, I watch fights and documentaries - that's it. If it's not about the birth and death of stars, 'Frozen Planet,' or someone getting punched in the face, I'm probably not watching it.

author: Chuck Palahniuk
text: Meeting authors is kind of the death of the characters. That is always heartbreaking.

author: John Keats
text: Land and sea, weakness and decline are great separators, but death is the great divorcer for ever.

author: Patricia Polacco
text: I don't know if my work is a concerted effort to make kids sad! But life and death go hand in hand. It's our condition as human beings.

author: Doc Hastings
text: I hope that the Senate acts quickly to pass this legislation so that Americans will no longer worry about having to sell the family farm or business to pay taxes after the death of a loved one.

author: Woody Allen
text: It is impossible to experience one's death objectively and still carry a tune.
